sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a length of 6 cm, a width of 4 cm at the base, and a height of 10 cm. Calculate the volume of the rectangular pyramid in cubic centimeters.
message_2:
To calculate the volume of a rectangular pyramid, we use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height

The base area of the rectangular pyramid is the product of its length and width:

Base Area = Length * Width = 6 cm * 4 cm = 24 cm²

Now, we can calculate the volume:

Volume = (1/3) * Base Area * Height = (1/3) * 24 cm² * 10 cm = (1/3) * 240 cm³ = 80 cm³

The volume of the rectangular pyramid is 80 cubic centimeters.
